zone.line: that class. her face was hard & rude like that

of per
s ons accustomed to see without sympa
thizing in sights of misery. She spoke with a
voice that ^ expressed her entire indifference – She
addressed me in Eglish & the words struck
me as one that I had heard during my suff
erings– Are you better now, s S ir, said she.
I replied in the same language
with a feeble voice; I believe I am but
if it all be true – if indeed I did not
dream I am sorry that I am still alive
to feel misery & horror.
For that matter, replied the old
wan woman, if you mean about
the gentleman that you murdered I
believe that it were better for you
if you were dead – for I fancy it will
go hard with you, but you will be
hanged when the next session comes
on – however that is none of my business
I am sent for to nurse you & get
you well–I do no more my duty with
a safe conscience; it were well if every
body did the same.–
I turned fro with looathing from
the woman who could utter so un

feeling a speech to ^ a
man person just saved on
the very edge of death; but I felt languid
and unable to reflect on all that had
passed; It sometimes The whole series of my life appeared as a dream
I sometimes I doubted if indeed it was not
all true but it never presented itself to
